sentences.english: The dispute was settled by mediation of the third country.
sentences.chinese: 这场争端通过第三国的斡旋而得以解决。

sentences.english: While the international community tried mediation, but the horse still unresolved political crisis.
sentences.chinese: 尽管国际社会极力斡旋，但马政治危机仍未解决。

sentences.english: The minister of foreign affairs mediated between two warring countries.
sentences.chinese: 外长在两个交战国之间进行积极的斡旋。

sentences.english: The amnesty, which was brokered by the U.
sentences.chinese: 特赦令是在美国和英国的斡旋之下达成的。

sentences.english: China supports the mediation work of Mr. Gambari and the UN Secretary-General.
sentences.chinese: 中国支持联合国秘书长以及甘巴里先生的斡旋努力。

sentences.english: Gambari notes Beijing's constructive contribution to mediation on the issue.
sentences.chinese: 甘巴里注意到北京在斡旋过程中具有建设性的贡献。

sentences.english: The constitution of mediatory acceptance of bribe has always been a problem at issue.
sentences.chinese: 斡旋受贿的构成一直是有争议的问题。

sentences.english: The accord follows months of negotiations mediated by South Africa.
sentences.chinese: 此前，各方在南非的斡旋下进行了几个月的谈判。

sentences.english: Mediation efforts could not stand the leaves, let the two battle.
sentences.chinese: 看不下去的叶子努力斡旋，不让两人对战。

sentences.english: The legislation of the crime of mediatory acceptance of bribe needs reconsideration.
sentences.chinese: 斡旋受贿的立法规定需要重新定位。

sentences.english: Negotiations with Russia fix the Central Asian frontier, and doom the Mongols.
sentences.chinese: 与俄罗斯斡旋确立中亚边境以及剿灭蒙古人。

definition: to reconcile/to mediate/to bring warring parties to agreement/to arbitrate
to lobby/to campaign/to promote (an idea, a product)/(old) to visit various rulers and promote one's political ideas (in the Warring States period)
to consult/to discuss seriously/to negotiate/to confer/negotiations/consultations
lit. to stop the enemy at the banquet table/fig. to get the better of an enemy during diplomatic functions
to settle (a dispute out of court)/to reconcile/settlement/conciliation/to become reconciled
to check and balance (power)/checks and balances
to appear personally/to step in/to step forth/to show up
